institution: University of Florence, Department of Neurosciences, Psychology, Drug and Child Health

project: Evaluation of the effect of different dietary regimes on central nervous system plasticity
description: Evaluated the effects of various types of diets on cortical and subcortical plasticity, using the visual cortex as a model area.

institution: IRCCS Fondazione Stella Maris, Scientific Institute for Child and Adolescent Neuropsychiatry, Calambrone, Pisa
project: Identification of neurovascular biomarkers using FNIRS in children with neurodevelopmental syndromes
description: Conducted imaging recordings using Functional Near Infrared Spectroscopy (FNIRS) in pediatric and adult patients to identify potential biomarkers in subjects with creatine transporter deficiency syndrome.

project: Pupillometric and imaging study in preclinical models of CDKL5 syndrome
description: Performed imaging and pupillometry recordings in preclinical models of CDKL5 deficiency syndrome, along with behavioral tests to correlate cortical processing with arousal states.

project: A Turin network for understanding and treating rare neurodevelopmental disorders: the CDKL5 syndrome model
description: Conducted pupillary activity recordings in animals with ubiquitous or conditional deletion of the CDKL5 gene, identifying crucial biomarkers for therapeutic trials.

project: Identification of functional biomarkers in neurodevelopmental disorder models
description: Conducted behavioral experiments to identify reliable biomarkers and developed an economical method for studying learning and memory processes using 3D printing.

project: Intrinsic signal imaging analysis of visual responses in CDKL5 syndrome models
description: Developed a deep learning-based technique for real-time pupillometry during navigation in virtual reality, identifying biomarkers of arousal abnormalities in CDKL5 deficiency models.

project: Intrinsic signal imaging analysis of visual responses in CDKL5 syndrome models
description: Studied a preclinical model of CDKL5 deficiency, identifying reliable biomarkers based on visual cortex responses using intrinsic signal imaging.

project: Study of excitatory and inhibitory inputs and synaptic plasticity in Rett syndrome models
description: Investigated the role of miR-132/212 in the development of the visual cortex and depth perception using conditional knockout models.

project: Physiological and behavioral evaluation of factors regulating functional development of the mouse visual cortex
description: Conducted behavioral tests, including the visual cliff test, to study depth perception development and stereopsis in preclinical models.

project: Evaluation of factors regulating the development of receptive fields in the mouse visual cortex
description: Developed spike sorting techniques for simultaneous electrophysiological recordings to study binocular plasticity and stereopsis.

project: Spike sorting analysis of responses in mouse visual cortex neurons
description: Applied spike sorting techniques to analyze neuronal responses in the visual cortex and study functional architecture in mouse models.
